alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT/7 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay and Quitman. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT /700 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 PM CDT /457 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgetown, Ricks Place, Bagby State Park, Bonapartes Retreat, Wire Bridge, Days Crossroads, Moores Crossroads, Hatcher, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Garnersville, Coates, Crossroads, Otho, Thomas Mill Creek, Double Bridges and Scottsboro Crossroads. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
